channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Passengers evacuate onto wing of burning American Airlines jet
item.description: Footage shows passengers huddled on the wing of the commercial airliner, which was on the tarmac, as flames burn under the aircraft.

item.title: A 2nd judge orders thousands of fired federal employees temporarily reinstated
item.description: A federal judge in Maryland found the Trump administration acted unlawfully in firing thousands of federal employees by not first notifying states.

item.title: (Don't) click here to pay your tolls: How you can stop spam texts
item.description: "Smishing" scams aim to compromise your data and pilfer money. And if you think the problem is getting worse, you're right.

item.title: Putin sets out conditions for Ukraine ceasefire
item.description: The Russian president agrees fighting must end, but calls for the removal of the "root causes" of the war he launched.

item.title: Passengers evacuate after American Airlines plane catches fire at DIA
item.description: An American Airlines plane carrying 178 people caught fire on the tarmac after making an emergency landing at Denver International Airport. Twelve pas...

item.title: 3/13: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: Changes to Justice Department’s Civil Rights Division under Trump; Reporter’s notebook: Reexamining the Swiss cheese model

item.title: New tariffs on U.S. wine industry are a "massive problem," says one wine trade group president
item.description: President Trump's trade battle with Canada is taking hold on U.S. alcohol suppliers. Last week, Canada imposed a 25% tariff on several U.S. products, ...

item.title: High stakes as China hosts Iran and Russia for nuclear talks
item.description: The meeting comes as a deal to limit Iran's nuclear programme expires later this year.

item.title: Once-routine immigration check-ins become high-stakes calculation as some are detained
Second federal judge orders White House to rehire fired probationary workers
item.description: The order from U.S. District Judge James Bredar came in a lawsuit filed by 19 states and the District of Columbia against multiple federal agencies al...

item.title: Big March storm system threatens US with tornadoes, blizzards and wildfire risk
item.description: A sweeping storm system moving across the U.S. threatens to bring tornadoes, blizzards and possibly wildfires to different regions of the country.

item.title: Some acne treatments from brands like Walgreens, La Roche-Posay voluntarily recalled
item.description: The FDA tested 95 products containing benzoyl peroxide, an ingredient widely used to treat acne that can form benzene as a byproduct. It found that si...

item.title: John Feinstein, sports writer and author of 'A Season on the Brink,' dies at 69
item.description: Feinstein was comfortable writing fiction and nonfiction, and took on an array of sports, including golf and tennis, but he was known most for his con...

item.title: How disease detectives are hunting for viruses at major U.S. airports
item.description: A CDC program tests wastewater from airplanes, looking for pathogens that may have hitched a ride with passengers on long-haul international flights.

item.title: 'Deep sense of outrage and betrayal': House Democrats react to Schumer announcement
item.description: House Democrats were gathered in Virginia for their annual issues conference when they received the news that Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer was...

item.title: Syria leader signs temporary constitution for five-year transition
item.description: The document enshrines separation of powers and guarantees women's rights, freedom of expression and media freedom.

item.title: USPS agrees to work with DOGE on reform, planning to cut 10,000 workers
'They killed all these young people' - BBC investigates alleged massacre in rebel-held Congolese city
item.description: The BBC speaks to multiple witnesses who say M23 fighters hunted down and killed young men in Goma.
